result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. FREDERICK G JOHNSON

records.addlTxt: **PROCESSING COMPLETE**
Notice of hearing for Plea/sentencing hearing set for November 8, 2022 at 1:45 PM has been returned. / Return to Sender. Not Deliverable as Addressed. Unable to Forward.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 8, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Pretrial Status Report

Defendant called to inform us that he borrowed a vehicle from a friend to come to do the processing and was stopped in Appleton and found that the vehicle was not registered anymore and his agent put him in jail on a 40 day sanction and will be released on October 11, 2022.

11:52 AM Defendant FREDERICK G JOHNSON appeared by video.  Attorney Michael J Kapelis in court for FREDERICK G JOHNSON.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Kapelis states he will be waiving the preliminary hearing. Defendant concurs. Defendant has no issue with holding this hearing via zoom. Court instructs the defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary examination. Defendant waives his/her right to a preliminary examination. Court finds probable cause. Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial.

State files an information with the court, same as the criminal complaint and copy to attorney Kapelis. Attorney Kapelis acknowledges receipt of the information and waives any reading. Atty Kapelis enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant. Court will set for Return Date on September 19, 2022 at 10:30 AM. Court questions defendant re: coming to GL for processing,. Court gives the defendant 30 days to complete the processing or a warrant will be issued.

Court adjourned at 11:56 AM
Return date scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Return date on September 19, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Letter to Judge Slate from Atty Michael Kapelis dated 06/20/2022 re: request for the defendant to appear via zoom due to not being able to arrange transportation and will be a waiver      (NOTE: 06/20 approved)
Preliminary hearing on June 21, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance.  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

9:44 AM Defendant FREDERICK G JOHNSON appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Def has no objection to holding this hearing by zoom. Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. Court questions defendant on why he is currently in custody. Statement by the def. Court instructs defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  ADA McElroy makes bond recommendation. Statement by defendant regarding bond. Court sets bond at $500 signature bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance.  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department. If this case is still pending and def is not in custody, Court might look at issuing a cash bond. Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing. Defendant waives the time limits. Court will set for Status of Counsel May 17, 2022 at 10:00 AM.

Court adjourned at 9:50 AM.
